column3: BRAC provides non-formal education facilitators and learning materials for marginalized children.
BRAC supports remedial classes and community learning centers near the school.
Save the Children runs after-school tutoring and life-skills sessions for adolescents.
Save the Children supports learning kits and attendance monitoring for at-risk students.
UNICEF supports school WASH facilities and child health screening campaigns.
UNICEF funds emergency education support and psychosocial activities for children.
World Vision provides fortified snacks and nutrition education sessions.
World Vision supports community-based nutrition volunteers linked to the school.
Plan International runs child protection clubs and safe reporting mechanisms in the school.
Plan International trains teachers on positive discipline and safeguarding practices.
ActionAid facilitates community awareness on child marriage and supports school retention.
ActionAid supports girlsâ€™ education circles and peer mentoring groups.
Directorate of Primary Education provides stipends and school improvement grants.
Directorate of Primary Education supports teacher deployment and training for early grades.
National Nutrition Services delivers school-based deworming and growth monitoring.
National Nutrition Services supports iron-folic acid supplements for adolescent girls.
Child Protection Unit links vulnerable children to social safety nets and case management.
Child Protection Unit offers counselling referrals and follow-up for children at risk.
